verses.kjv: It is not expedient for me doubtless to glory. I will come to visions and revelations of the Lord.
verses.ct: Boasting may not be helpful, but I need to move on to visions and revelations from the Lord.

verses.kjv: I knew a man in Christ above fourteen years ago, (whether in the body, I cannot tell; or whether out of the body, I cannot tell: God knoweth;) such an one caught up to the third heaven.
verses.ct: I know someone who belongs to Christ who, 14 years ago, was taken up to the 3rd heaven. Whether this happened physically or just in his spirit, I don't know — only God knows.

verses.kjv: And I knew such a man, (whether in the body, or out of the body, I cannot tell: God knoweth;)
verses.ct: I know this man — whether it was in his body or apart from his body, I don't know; God knows —

verses.kjv: How that he was caught up into paradise, and heard unspeakable words, which it is not lawful for a man to utter.
verses.ct: was taken up into paradise and heard things too sacred to be expressed, things that no human is permitted to speak.

verses.kjv: Of such an one will I glory: yet of myself I will not glory, but in mine infirmities.
verses.ct: I'll boast about someone like that, but I won't boast about myself — except about my weaknesses.

verses.kjv: For though I would desire to glory, I shall not be a fool; for I will say the truth: but now I forbear, lest any man should think of me above that which he seeth me to be, or that he heareth of me.
verses.ct: Even if I chose to boast, I wouldn't be foolish, because I'd be telling the truth. But I'll hold back so that no one thinks more highly of me than what they can see in my life or hear from my words.

verses.kjv: And lest I should be exalted above measure through the abundance of the revelations, there was given to me a thorn in the flesh, the messenger of Satan to buffet me, lest I should be exalted above measure.
verses.ct: To keep me from becoming too proud because of the extraordinary nature of these revelations, I was given a painful affliction in my body — a messenger of Satan to torment me — so that I wouldn't become arrogant.

verses.kjv: For this thing I besought the Lord thrice, that it might depart from me.
verses.ct: 3 times I pleaded with the Lord to take it away from me.

verses.kjv: And he said unto me, My grace is sufficient for thee: for my strength is made perfect in weakness. Most gladly therefore will I rather glory in my infirmities, that the power of Christ may rest upon me.
verses.ct: But he told me, 'My grace is all you need, because my power reaches its full potential in weakness.' So I will gladly boast all the more about my weaknesses, so that the power of Christ may settle on me.

verses.kjv: Therefore I take pleasure in infirmities, in reproaches, in necessities, in persecutions, in distresses for Christ’s sake: for when I am weak, then am I strong.
verses.ct: That's why I'm content with weaknesses, insults, hardships, persecutions, and difficulties for Christ's sake. Because when I am weak, that's when I am strong.

verses.kjv: I am become a fool in glorying; ye have compelled me: for I ought to have been commended of you: for in nothing am I behind the very chiefest apostles, though I be nothing.
verses.ct: I've made a fool of myself by boasting like this, but you forced me into it. You should have been the ones speaking up for me, since I'm not the least bit inferior to those so-called 'super-apostles' — even though I'm nothing on my own.

verses.kjv: Truly the signs of an apostle were wrought among you in all patience, in signs, and wonders, and mighty deeds.
verses.ct: The credentials of a true apostle were demonstrated among you with great endurance — through signs, wonders, and powerful miracles.

verses.kjv: For what is it wherein ye were inferior to other churches, except it be that I myself was not burdensome to you? forgive me this wrong.
verses.ct: In what way were you treated worse than the other churches, except that I personally never became a financial burden to you? Forgive me for that terrible offense!

verses.kjv: Behold, the third time I am ready to come to you; and I will not be burdensome to you: for I seek not yours, but you: for the children ought not to lay up for the parents, but the parents for the children.
verses.ct: Look, this is the 3rd time I'm prepared to visit you, and I won't be a burden to you. I'm not after your money — I want you. After all, children shouldn't have to save up for their parents; parents should save up for their children.

verses.kjv: And I will very gladly spend and be spent for you; though the more abundantly I love you, the less I be loved.
verses.ct: I will happily spend everything I have — and exhaust myself completely — for your sake. If I love you more and more, does that mean I'll be loved less and less?

verses.kjv: But be it so, I did not burden you: nevertheless, being crafty, I caught you with guile.
verses.ct: Fine, so I wasn't a burden to you. But some of you say I was sneaky and trapped you through deception.

verses.kjv: Did I make a gain of you by any of them whom I sent unto you?
verses.ct: Did I ever exploit you through anyone I sent to you?

verses.kjv: I desired Titus, and with him I sent a brother. Did Titus make a gain of you? walked we not in the same spirit? walked we not in the same steps?
verses.ct: I urged Titus to visit you and sent our brother along with him. Did Titus take advantage of you? Didn't we operate with the same spirit? Didn't we follow the same path?

verses.kjv: Again, think ye that we excuse ourselves unto you? we speak before God in Christ: but we do all things, dearly beloved, for your edifying.
verses.ct: Have you been thinking all along that we're defending ourselves to you? We speak in the presence of God as people who belong to Christ, and everything we do, dear friends, is for building you up.

verses.kjv: For I fear, lest, when I come, I shall not find you such as I would, and that I shall be found unto you such as ye would not: lest there be debates, envyings, wraths, strifes, backbitings, whisperings, swellings, tumults:
verses.ct: My concern is that when I arrive, I won't find you the way I want to, and you won't find me the way you want me to be. I'm worried there may be quarreling, jealousy, outbursts of anger, selfish rivalries, slander, gossip, arrogance, and chaos among you.

verses.kjv: And lest, when I come again, my God will humble me among you, and that I shall bewail many which have sinned already, and have not repented of the uncleanness and fornication and lasciviousness which they have committed.
verses.ct: I'm afraid that when I come again, my God will humble me in front of you, and I'll end up grieving over many who sinned before and still haven't turned away from the moral corruption, sexual immorality, and shameless behavior they've been practicing.
